latest news.eng_title: US Stores Closing in 2024: A List of Familiar Names
latest news.summary: Several well-known US stores have announced their closure in 2024 due to economic problems and declining sales. The list includes Lumberg Liquidators, which filed for bankruptcy and will close 94 stores, Stop & Shop, which will close 32 stores in five states, Bob's Stores, which will close all its locations, 99 Cents Only, which will close all its stores in Arizona, California, Nevada, and Texas, and Big Lots, which will close 315 stores and hold special clearance sales. Macy's, a clothing and fashion brand, has announced a new marketing plan that includes closing 150 underperforming locations by 2026. This will affect shopping malls in the US and leave a void in the market. 'The decline in sales and economic challenges have put these stores in a difficult position,' said a spokesperson for one of the affected companies.
latest news.title: Famosas tiendas dejarán de funcionar en Estados Unidos en 2024: conoce la lista y los remates con descuentos

latest news.eng_title: 8 Major US Retail Chains to Close Locations in 2024
latest news.summary: According to a report by CoreSight, a data analytics firm, US supermarket closures increased by 24% in the beginning of this year compared to the previous year. This decision has caused uncertainty and concern not only among consumers but also among workers. The main reasons for these massive closures are low performance, increased retail theft, inflationary pressure on consumers who are cutting back on discretionary spending due to high prices, and the shift towards e-commerce. This demonstrates that the retail industry has been going through one of its toughest moments since 2022, with the added challenge of maintaining competitiveness by offering the most affordable prices. As a result, many companies have opted to close underperforming locations. The following 8 major US retail chains will be closing locations in the remaining months of 2024: Walmart (10 locations in California), Big Lots (315 due to low performance), Family Dollar (over 1,000 stores nationwide), Macy's (150 locations by 2026 as part of a marketing plan), 99 Cents Only (all locations, mainly affecting Arizona, California, Nevada, and Texas), Stop & Shop (32 locations in New Jersey, Massachusetts, New York, Connecticut, and Rhode Island), Bob's Stores (all locations, declared bankruptcy), and 'no information was found for the 8th chain'.
latest news.title: Estas 8 grandes cadenas de EE.UU. cerrarán más tiendas en 2024

latest news.eng_title: Eight Major US Chains Announce Store Closures in 2024
latest news.summary: A wave of store closures is sweeping the United States. According to El Tiempo, several well-known American brands have announced closures in recent months due to low performance, bankruptcy, and abandonment of states. Here are some of the most notable ones: Lumberg Liquidators, now known as LL Flooring, has begun closing 94 of its stores across the US after declaring bankruptcy in Delaware. Macy's has announced a new marketing plan that includes closing 150 'unpopular' locations by 2026. Stop & Shop has announced the closure of 32 stores in five northeastern states. Bob's Stores has announced that it will close all its locations and become 'the last retail victim in the US', according to the New York Post. 99 Cents Only has announced that it will close all its US stores, affecting Arizona, California, Nevada, and Texas. Big Lots has confirmed that it will close 315 stores across the US due to poor performance.

latest news.eng_title: Big Lots, Family Dollar, Red Lobster: Which chains have closed locations in Ohio in 2024?
latest news.summary: Several retail chains have announced store closures in Ohio in 2024, including LL Flooring, Family Dollar, Rite Aid, Macy's, Walgreens, Big Lots, Outback Steakhouse, Red Lobster, and Express. According to the article, LL Flooring plans to close four Ohio stores, while Family Dollar has already closed 35 stores in the state. Rite Aid has closed at least 35 locations, with 13 more added in July. Macy's plans to shut down 150 stores by 2026, with around 50 expected to close by the end of 2024. Walgreens plans to close over 90 stores nationwide, while Big Lots will close at least eight stores in Ohio. Outback Steakhouse has closed two locations, and Red Lobster has cut nine Ohio restaurants. Express has also closed two locations in the state. Additionally, Buca di Beppo has filed for bankruptcy and is expected to close one of its four Ohio locations by April 2026. 'Elevated inflation' and a significant decrease in consumer spending have been cited as reasons for some of the closures.
latest news.title: Big Lots, Family Dollar, Red Lobster: Which chains have closed locations in Ohio in 2024?

news knowledge.eng_title: Big Lots Set to Close Up to 315 Stores
news knowledge.summary: Big Lots has received approval to close up to 315 stores after expressing 'substantial doubt' on continuing business operations due to ongoing negative macroeconomic factors and high interest rates. The company has incurred net losses in 2022, 2023, and the first quarter of 2024, and expects to experience further operating losses. According to S&P, many companies may seek reorganization bankruptcy in the coming months, providing them with time to stabilize their financial situation. 'Based on current trends and economic indicators, I expect bankruptcy filing volumes to continue this steady increase throughout the remainder of 2024 and into 2025,' S&P stated. The company's $900 million credit facility was reduced to $800 million and interest rates on borrowings have been raised by 50 basis points. 'Due to ongoing negative macroeconomic factors and their uncertain impacts on the company's business, results of operations, and cash flows, the company expects to experience further operating losses,' according to the filing.
news knowledge.title: Big Lots Set to Close Up to 315 Stores

news knowledge.eng_title: Ohio-based Big Lots names nearly 150 stores closing amid bankruptcy risk
news knowledge.summary: Big Lots, a discount retail chain headquartered in Ohio, has identified nearly 150 stores that are closing this year amid speculation the company will file for bankruptcy. The closings come as Big Lots' sales dropped 10.2% between the first quarters of 2023 and 2024, resulting in a loss of about $114 million. The company wrote, 'In 2024, the U.S. economy has continued to face macroeconomic challenges including elevated inflation, which has adversely impacted the buying power of our customers.' The retailer has more than 100 locations in Ohio, none of which are marked online as closing. Big Lots' total debt has increased to $573.8 million, leading to substantial doubt about the company's ability to continue. If Big Lots files for bankruptcy, it will join a list of other stores and restaurants that have done so since the COVID-19 pandemic.
news knowledge.title: Ohio-based Big Lots names nearly 150 stores closing amid bankruptcy risk

news knowledge.eng_title: Big Lots is closing stores in 2024, joins growing list of retailers at risk of bankruptcy
news knowledge.summary: Big Lots, a discount retail chain, is planning to close at least 35 stores in 2024 due to declining sales and potential bankruptcy concerns. The company reported a loss of $205 million in the first quarter of this year and expects sales to continue dropping. The planned closures come as the retailer's total store count has decreased from 1,427 to 1,392 locations. Big Lots' CEO, Bruce Thorn, attributed the decline in sales to a pullback in consumer spending, particularly in high-ticket discretionary items. The company's debt has also increased by $72.2 million, bringing its total debt to $573.8 million. The locations of the closing stores have not been disclosed.

news knowledge.eng_title: Struggling retail chain faces default, Ch. 11 bankruptcy risk
news knowledge.summary: Big Lots, a discount retailer using the treasure-hunt model, is struggling and faces the risk of default and Chapter 11 bankruptcy. The company has been losing money since 2022 and has sold some of its real estate to improve cash flow. However, the company's liquidity projections indicate a significant likelihood of default within the next 12 months, raising concerns about its ability to continue as a going concern. Rapid Ratings, a company that tracks default risk, has also expressed concerns about Big Lots' financial situation, citing poor profits and weak balance sheets. The company's ability to keep its vendors on board is crucial to its survival, as vendors may demand cash up front if they question the company's ability to pay its bills.

news knowledge.eng_title: Massive Big-Box Retailer Faces Bankruptcy, Fate of 1,392 Stores Unknown
news knowledge.summary: Big Lots, a national discount chain, has been facing financial struggles due to sluggish sales. In their recent earnings call, CEO Bruce Thorn reported a loss of $132.3 million in Q1 2024, citing a continued pullback in consumer spending on high-ticket discretionary items. Despite remaining positive about future sales growth, the company acknowledged their losses in 2022, 2023, and 2024, and noted that they may experience further operating losses and difficulty remaining in compliance with their credit agreements.
